text: so how do you get your cranberry sauce
to gel you know sometimes you make it
into gels sometimes you make it and it
doesn't but if you want cranberry sauce
to look like this perfectly jellied I
will show you how far to cook it because
the secret is you have to cook it enough
it should look like jam before you take
it off the stove no matter what recipe
you're using you want to start with
whole cranberries you've got some kind
of liquid in this case orange juice
whatever you like wine apple cider plain
old water is good and then sugar you
need to use enough sugar for it to set
up so make it sweet Plus these things
are pretty tart satisfying
so at this point you're just going to
let your berries simmer until they start
to pop and then once they start to pop
continue to cook them until it gets
thick what you're looking for is jam
something that looks like cranberry Jam
most people think that once the berries
start to pop they can pull it off the
heat but you know what there's probably
going to be too much liquid in the pan
and then it's not going to set up you
can add any other kinds of aromatics
graded citrus rind is amazing spices
cinnamon a little pinch of cloves if you
want to make it savory you could add
coriander is delicious garlic even some
caramelized onion depending on how much
liquid you use this can take anywhere
from five minutes to 15 so you know just
keep checking it once the sugar
dissolves you can stop stirring turn the
heat down to low and go do your thing
just keep checking it every once in a
while okay it's been about 10 minutes as
you can see look at that it looks like
jam and you see how small the bubbles
are that's what you're looking for those
little bubbles the splatter e kind nice
and thick and this is when you turn off
the heat because that's all there is to
it put it in a decorative mold you could
put it in a bowl as you can see i just
use the flat container and it looks
great
